page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Twenty years ago most of the men in the village worked at one of four jobs:farming,the Royal Navy,Clark's shoe factory or Westland helicopters. Nowadays there are almost as many different jobs as there are children in school.These include -accountant, architect,B.A.C.,butcher,carpenter, club owner,computer programmer,council workman,engineer,farmer,garage mechanic, mechanic,helicopter maker, joiner,labourer,lorrydriver,mechanic, oddjob man,plasterer,plumber,policeman postmaster,quarryman,Royal Engineers, Royal Navy,stone mason,teacher.Most parents work outside the village.There are many teachers in the village.They work in the village school,at Wells, Street,Glastonbury,Ilchester,Yeovil, Sherborne,Millfield School and at Bruton.
